FuncDef:
The pw-redundancy mac-withdraw rfc-compatible command instructs peer PEs to clear MAC addresses for the PWs whose primary/secondary status has been changed in a PW redundancy scenario.
The undo pw-redundancy mac-withdraw rfc-compatible command restores the default configuration.
By default, if the primary/secondary PW status changes in a PW redundancy scenario, the peer PEs are not instructed to clear MAC addresses of the changed PWs.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
For example, as shown in Figure 1 in "Example for Splicing a VXLAN EVPN with a VPLS", in a scenario where VXLAN is terminated on a VPLS network and PW redundancy is configured, for example, VXLAN EVPN is configured in VPLS networking, when the active/standby status of PE1 and PE2 changes, PE3 performs PW switching and notifies PE1 and PE2 of the current PW status, as shown in the following figure, clear the MAC addresses of PE1 and PE2.
